main event: A red flare-like object with a 100-foot tail was seen drifting in the sky over Point Reyes, California on August 4, 1952.
interesting points: The object was sighted around 2044 PDT (Pacific Daylight Time) on August 4, 1952.
The object was seen by personnel from two different Ground Control Guidance (GCG) posts, post NJ 22 (red) and post NJ 23 (black).
The object was headed northward approximately 2 miles east of Point Reyes, California.
Several witnesses reported the sighting, including Mrs. from Novato, Miss. from Sebastopol, Sonoma County, and Mrs. from Hillsburg, Sonoma County.
The weather was reported to be clear at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: a red flare-like object with a 100-foot tail
witnesses: personnel from two GCG posts and several local residents
